pageContext.claim: “We have -- we have companies coming into this country at a record pace, and really at a pace that nobody thought possible because nobody thought you'd ever see these particular companies again....But they left years ago, and now they're coming back, and they're coming back in numbers that nobody believes.”
pageContext.analysis: There is no data to support the notion that companies are coming into the United States at a record pace. Data from the Reshoring Initiative indicate that job announcements of companies returning, a trend that started under Barack Obama, were lower in 2018 than in 2017. Foreign investment in the United States grew at a slower annual pace in the first two years of Trump’s tenure than during Barack Obama’s presidency, according to Commerce Department data released in July, 2019.
